Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a habitat on land (like a playground or garden) and show different plants and animals that live there.
The student can draw a water habitat (like a pond or stream) and include different water plants and animals.
The student can compare the types of plants in a land habitat to those in a water habitat by showing them in their drawings.
The student can compare the types of animals in a land habitat to those in a water habitat by showing them in their drawings.
The student can observe different patterns in the drawings, like how similar plants or animals might live in more than one habitat type.
The student can record the names of plants and animals drawn in each habitat.
